text: 23 EU citizens and development cooperation June 2019 Report Special Eurobarometer 494 3 Tackling poverty in developing countries is in the EU’s own interest More than three quarters agree tackling poverty in developing countries is also in the EU’s own interest A large majority of respondents (79%) agree tackling poverty in developing countries is also in the EU’s own interest, with 31% saying they ‘totally agree’ 10 . Just over one in ten (13%) disagree. Overall agreement has declined by three points since 2016, and is now one point higher than it was in 2014. 10 QH5.3. To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? Tackling poverty in developing countries is also in the EU’s own interest (e.g. by creating trade opportunities or better access to energy and raw materials): Totally agree; Tend to agree; Tend to disagree; Totally disagree; Don’t Know.
48 EU citizens and development cooperation June 2019 Report Special Eurobarometer 494
